comments.body: Legacy Console UI is the best version of the two. Bring it forward Minecraft!

I 100% agree with this. The UI and control difference is what is keeping me away from this version of the game. 

 

I much rather go back to the 360 and play (Which is what I'm doing) than play bedrock at this point.
Yes please add this I'm super interested in a UI/GUI that has the original design of the console.
Mojang please do this, we‚Äôre fine with Bedrock but make it more comfortable to use and navigate
Yes please. I'm staying on Legacy Xbox One Edition just because of this.
I don't play much any more, entirely because the current UI is horrible with a controller.

I am okay with change. The new UI appearance wise is really not at all that much worse than the Legacy Console UI. But I do not enjoy change when it involves an objectively slower and buggier response time than the product is been using for god knows how long know. I do not know how hard it was to make a responsive UI but it needs to be prioritized. This is one of the largest reasons I still see this version of the game inferior even though you guys have stopped updating the Legacy Consoles. This game has so many options and ways of playing, without polish it becomes overwhelming clunky and annoying to play.

PLEASE BRING BACK THE GUI FROM THE DEDICATED CONSOLE EDITIONS!

Minecraft Bedrock has a terrible GUI for controllers and doesn't have feature parity with the dedicated versions. We can't block death messages for example. The designers don't have to think about anything. Only the developers need to think about the implementation. It was so much faster and easier to use before. Stampylongnose and ibxtoycat have discussed the GUI in great depth.

 

And DO NOT forget that Android and W10 can use controllers, keyboards + mice and touch and Xbox is now getting keyboard + mouse support soon. It's also worth noting that Sony is finally getting into crossplay. They are pretty mad about the store though. You should also release Bedrock Edition for Linux (rpm and deb) and macOS. I am aware of the method to use the Android version on Linux by the way.

I strongly agree. Right or wrong, people in general tend to prefer the UI they are used to. I find myself preferring versions other than the Bedrock edition simply because I don't like how the UI looks. At the same time, I'm sure others like the new version. If it was an option to make it all look like classic - maybe even a reskinned UI feature for the store - I would probably move to Bedrock sooner. If the goal really is to unify them all then anything to feed nostalgia should be explored.

I will likely avoid Bedrock entirely until this is a thing. To emphasize how serious this is, I quit multiple MMORPG games entirely because of UI changes and NEVER went back. Changes to UI can outright kill a game.
I agree !!! Keep updating the Xbox one edition

Please bring back the Legacy Console UI for crafting, inventory, and other in-game interfaces as an option that we can turn on/off. I would love to start playing the Bedrock edition if this gets resolved.

I haven't played Minecraft in several years because I just don't have a comfortable desk with mouse/keyboard setup and I'm not interested in building one.  I grew up with a controller in my hand and I like to game comfy on the couch.  

When Microsoft gets it right they really get it right.  I'm so impressed with how slick and modern the Bedrock edition feels.  The controller support is fantastic, the inventory and crafting menus are smooth and intuitive.  I expected a nostalgia trip when I logged in for the first time in years and instead I'm totally engrossed in the Marketplace and Realms and all the great new features that console now gets to enjoy.

Microsoft, keep moving Windows into Linux, keep making VSCode the best got dang code editor in the world, and give me controller support in Minecraft Java and I might have to start calling myself a Microsoft fan after decades of strict avoidance.

I stop playing minecraft with mouse and keyboard after a bad discovery, mi hand finger become ice after a while that i use mouse or keyborad, only the controller can grant a good position for my problem and java edition don't support the controller... in the 21st century? really? seriusly is time to add this compatibilty feature because for some people are very essential!!

 

In any case I'm very fortunate because on my PC I use a DualShock 4 with its wi-fi adapter that accompanied by a special software I can configure the controller to emulate a x360 controller (for these game that don't support DS4 controller input) or mouse and keyboard input (for these gama that don't support the controller input in general), but a native support to xbox or ps4 controller... if made... are very wellcome.

I'm disabled, and using a controller is MUCH better for my back and neck, than being hunched over to use keyboard and mouse. It's literally PAINFUL for me to game without using my XBox 360 controller.

So I haven't been playing much as my condition is worsening. But my friends really miss me, and I miss them. Are you guys going to really keep us apart like this? And cause me pain? :(

I have Steam set up and a decent fan-made control configuration... but navigating the menus to craft, sort, access chests/inventory etc is TORTURE on this type of control currently. So imprecise and maddening! I have to hold my breath to try and select something every time.

So this work-around is NOT AT ALL sufficient. :(

Please, give us proper controller support. Regular mouse/WASD type movement in normal mode... But then also, in the menus, the controller is put into a secondary function optimized to kind of snap to each square/button (by giving it a grid, basically), the way other games treat Menu controls vs gameplay controls. It CAN be done!

Please? It's SO long overdue, and those of us who desperately need the accessibility are losing years of our short lives waiting and waiting, watching our friends slowly leave and we can't spend that precious time gaming with them... :(

As a Server host myself I think I can speak for a lot of us when I say you should really add it so that custom servers can have their own news/activities/MOTD menu page on the side as well. I'm sure there would be concerns about people using it to perform inappropriate things like inappropriate images, words, etc. but just as any platform would have I'm certain you can easily set up restrictions and/or ways to report inappropriate activities. Doing this would definitely help you grow your online server community, so that people that aren't into downloading unnecessary apps and using a bunch of websites just to stay up to date with their favorite servers. I propose a way to do this is to either set it up through the bedrock dedicated server files you provide or find a way to do it through Minecraft bedrock itself, or possibly a better/easier/more organized way to do it would be to make a separate app just for customizing such parts of one's server (something like "Minecraft BDS Menu Editor" as like a title for the app).

"Create World" button no longer opens "Create World" screen

 

In the latest version of the "Play" screen, the "Create World" button no longer opens the "Create World" screen. Instead, it opens the "Create from Template" screen, which was previously done with the "Create from Template" button. Since the introduction of OreUI, these buttons have been separated, but now they are once again combined, as they were in JsonUI.

This leads to some issues:

  • It is an unnecessary extra step. Most players create normal worlds much more often than templates, so adding an extra step makes it unnecessarily slow for the majority of users.
  • It is expected that a button does whatever is written on it. But in the current version of the UI, the "Create World" button opens an additional screen where the actual "Create World" button is hidden.

Please make it go to  "Owned by me" first, looks (respectfully) very cheap and trashy (too money grabbing low quality) when its right at marketplace, however, if you have the owned by me section first you can still make money with the marketplace pass.

I have 4 reasons for why this UI needs to be reworked and or made optional / removed entirely from Minecraft and to have the old UI back.

1. The UI is confusing and has unnecessary upselling.
The UI is confusing because when I want to create a new world, I want to create a new world, I don't want to load a template or see what's on marketplace pass. Matter of fact, I think that the user shouldn't even be forced to see what's on marketplace pass if they don't own it.

2. The UI does not support low resolutions well.
On low resolutions, elements such as buttons stretch to fill more than 20% of the screen in some cases. This is unnecessary and looks ugly.

3. The UI runs poorly on a flagship phone (ROG Phone 6)
It takes more than 5 seconds in usual cases to open "create a new world" with my phone. It should not take this long.

4. It breaks UI mods and features.
UI mods no longer work with this new UI update. An example of a mod that has been broken from this update is a mod called "MCPE Export Button" which allows you to export worlds directly from Minecraft instead of digging for that file inside of Minecraft's Android/Data folder. Which as of recent is becoming inaccessible for security and privacy concerns from Google. Thus resulting in worlds to no longer be able to be exported from mobile devices.

My solutions to these problems are to either rework the UI entirely to solve these problems that users are facing or to abolish the UI entirely or make it optional.

Hi everyone,

(F1 and F5 for what? in-game selfies?).

I can't ignore that you made few valid points when it comes to touch/hold controls. When it comes to everyday mining, the hold trigger makes mining a single block longer meaing that large mining projects are very time consuming while often enough, tools with efficiency enchantments mine more blocks than indended.

Also, the middle button that appears only under certain circumstances such as "Fish", or "Trade" is awkward to reach and since it is unique to Pocket Edition, it takes time getting used to. I still ocassionally, slap a villager before trading.

When it comes to casual gameplay, I suggest to take inspiration from consoles and have similar "X/Y" or, "A/B" buttons to be placed on screen for "Use/Place" and "Attack". Also having said buttons toggleable in settings wouldn't affect existing players and would benefit those who played on different platform such as PC, or XBOX before.

Now the combat gameplay, it doesn't go without saying that being forced to rotate camera while simultaneously tapping on the screen to attack is a proper pain and in my opinion, the "combat mode" post suggested, would make combat too easy.

One of the comments suggested ability to lock camera to a mob so you can move back, forth, and around your target to sidestep, defend, or attack without interrupting cameras' view.

I imagined this combat system to resemble that of a RPG game "Gothic I" from 2001 I played in my youth.

Thank you very much for reading.

Currently, opening a world to LAN can be port forwarded, which would achieve this, but whenever you connect to any server, like google, your router makes a small port forward so that your browser can get the replies. Ok so some thoughts:

This is a REALLY good step forward for flat survival players such as myself but here's a list of key features we need added in the future:

 

- The ability to choose the biome of the world

- The ability to manually pick and choose what blocks we have as our layers

- The ability to toggle structures on/off in the world creation to make Flat worlds more interesting

- The ability to toggle on/off decorations to spawn in the word such as trees, grass and ores.

- The ability to toggle dungeons on/off in world creation

- Lava/Water lake toggle options

- The ability to let cave systems generate in the world creation menu

 

These options are all from Legacy Console Edition, or as I like to refer to it, 4J Edition.

Adding these features to bedrock will take time to add and I understand that, but please at least

- Add the ability to use custom-made presets for flat worlds.

I found an awkward workaround that worked for me on Android:

  1. Check current storage location setting is set to "Application" (under Settings -> General -> Profile). If not, then change it and restart Minecraft.
  2. Set File Storage Location to "External"
  3. Come out of Settings and go to Play
  4. You should still be able to see all your worlds in Application storage
  5. Pick a world, click the Edit icon, scroll to the bottom and click "Copy World"
  6. You'll get an error message saying that the copy failed. This is NOT true, what has happened is that your world has been copied to External storage, but Minecraft is still showing worlds from Application storage.
  7. Repeat for all the worlds you want to copy.
  8. Exit Minecraft and restart
  9. Click Play and you're now looking at all your worlds in External storage!

It worked for me, but YMMV and I'm no expert. Good luck everyone.

I have found a way to make local backups.

1. Upload your world to realms. In my experience you can ignore if it says that it has failed to upload (as long as it appears under backups)

2. Change your storage from internal to external in the minecraft settings.

3. Download your world in the backups section of realms.

4. You now have your world in external storage.

Hello Mojang! As a mobile player, I love the versatility the adjustable joystick brings. However, there are a few minor changes I would make.

I wish there was a setting that allows me to change how far right (or left if you're a lefty) the movable joystick can go. As a regular gamer, having only one thumb to interact doesn‚Äôt feel right. Having a joystick in the middle of my screen gets in the way of using both fingers. It would be nice to have it go up and down as well as side to side.

The joystick lock option could also be improved, as the only current option is to set it back to default. The one thing I would change about it is a personal lock. By that I mean once adjusted, the lock could keep it there rather than going back to default. This could apply to both the joystick and the other controls as well. Some might prefer the controls to be a bit lower, while others may want them up high.

In any case, the product thus far is great and this is a huge step forward. Love and appreciate all the hard work and dedication the devs have put into this game over the years! Whether my two-sense makes it in or not, I love you all and thanks for the memories!

Sincerely your unwaveringly loyal player: Reahn15

Hello, I would like to share my feedback on the new settings interface in Minecraft Preview.

I find the old interface more convenient and faster to use than the new one.

  • Main settings interface: Before, the spaces between the buttons on the left menu were small, but in the new interface there are large spaces that aren't really needed. I prefer the old interface because I could scroll to the bottom by turning my mouse wheel only twice, while in the new one I have to scroll five times.
  • Audio settings interface: I think the old audio settings were better because the sound controls were on the right side of the screen, so it was easier to change the volume and quickly go change something else right after. In the new interface, the audio settings are in a separate screen. Because of that, it takes more time to adjust the sound and then go to another setting, since I have to go back to the main settings menu first.

I would also like to be able to change the volume of redstone-related sounds. When I use a lot of pistons, the sound gets really loud and I have to mute the game, which is a bit frustrating.

Thank you.

As more sections move to the new UI, the need for a sidebar becomes clearer. It‚Äôs inconvenient to jump between screens, and information feels too stretched out even on my 16:9 monitor, not to mention 21:9 ones.

The redesigned Video Settings are organized much better than before, but there‚Äôs still room for improvement. For example, why is ‚ÄúIn-game graphics mode switching‚Äù at the top (or why does it even need to exist), while it‚Äôs used only once and the much more frequently used ‚ÄúField of View‚Äù slider is buried at the bottom.

Options like ‚ÄúRender Clouds,‚Äù ‚ÄúFancy Leaves,‚Äù and ‚ÄúFancy Bubbles‚Äù would fit better under dropdown for each graphics mode, with values stored separately. That way players could enable both ‚ÄúFancy Leaves‚Äù and ‚ÄúFancy Bubbles‚Äù for Vibrant Visuals, keep only ‚ÄúFancy Leaves‚Äù for Fancy Graphics, disable both for Simple Graphics, and switch between them with a click.

Finally, the current Touch Controls settings screen feels cluttered, offering only three barely customizable presets. Joystick/D-Pad, Crosshair/Touch-to-interact, and button layout should be set separately, allowing players to mix what works best for them, for example, using ‚ÄúInteract‚Äù and ‚ÄúAttack‚Äù buttons with Joystick+Tap-to-interact, or the Joystick+Crosshair without any buttons, or combine buttons with the D-Pad. It‚Äôs also inconsistent that Crosshair/Touch-to-interact are fixed when using the joystick but toggleable, and from a completely different place, when using the D-Pad.

Currently, the in-game World settings only have Game and Multiplayer tabs, which is basically the same layout as in older versions of the Create New World screen. Since in the modern Create New World screen the Game tab was split into General, Advanced, and Cheats, which was INCREDIBLY convenient, it would be better if the in-game World settings followed the same structure instead of merging everything back into a single tab.

Example:

WORLD

  • General (previously Game)
  • Advanced (previously Game)
  • Multiplayer
  • Cheats (previously Game)
  • Resource Packs
  • Behavior Packs
  • Experiments

If some sections, such as Experiments or Language, can‚Äôt be changed in-game, they still shouldn‚Äôt be hidden. A simple message like:

‚ÄúThis setting can only be changed from the Edit World / Main Settings screen‚Äù

would be enough.


Sometimes it‚Äôs important to see which Resource Packs and Behavior Packs are enabled, even if you can‚Äôt change them in-game ‚Äî you can view them, but not modify. Mojang, I feel there are similarities between Bedrock's OreUI and Samsung's OneUI. The similarities I've found are as follows: 1. OneUI and OreUI both only allow for basic customization. In OneUI, you can install themes, but only system icons and wallpapers can be changed. Similarly, OreUI currently only supports changing panoramas and home screen buttons; nothing else can be changed. However, there are also differences here: 1. OneUI has Goodlock, which allows users to edit third-party app icons, change themes, appearance, layouts, and more, without voiding the warranty. However, OreUI is locked and cannot be freely modified like it was with JsonUI. Mojang, please create a package that allows editing OreUI separately from the ResourcePack or create a new readable folder within the ResourcePack. This is all I can assess for this new OreUI. Hopefully Mojang reads this! Also, FIX MOJANG BEDROCK!

Making limited world sizes would not significantly increase performance of old devices. You see, Minecraft's generation doesn't happen all at once, chunks are generated whenever the player gets near them. So if you don't want to rack up a giant world size, simply stay close to spawn.

I know my family would benefit from the option to choose smaller world sizes. We had a game with the option on the Xbox console edition, and we played that a ton. Mostly because it was a challenge to find certain things, but not impossible. I would randomly find abandoned mines, mansions, and more! With the newer seeds, it seems very difficult. Using the locator command, we discovered that the nearest wood mansion was some 9k from our spawn point. At that point, I feel like it slows down the pace of the game and make it easy to give up. The option would definitely improve our survival experience.

May not help performance too much, but look at my post about it.  I like infinite don't get me wrong.  But sometimes I would like to go wander far, taking a bed with me.  sleep a few times, thus changing spawn point.  Then lets say I die.  I'm far from home when I respawn, my map is still in the blast crater from that charged creeper, so I either have to pray and hope I find my stuff before it's too late, or try to recognize my route home.  If I get lost, say, in console edition this way, with world size set to "large" (Plenty of room for multiple biomes and such, but with a defined barrier) then I have Legacy console editions insurance policy of "Home is somewhere within this 8000x8000 block area." If I roam long enough, then, at some point i have a shot at rediscovering my well-established base.  Compare to "Infinite", where, if I get lost in said example, then it becomes "Home is somewhere between infinity and beyond!"  Thus, I may never find my base again.  "Old" world size is too small really in most cases.  So, I'd like to see Small, Medium, Large, and Infinite world size options.  I do use infinite worlds often, where I can keep going until I find what I like.  But sometimes I like to have the generous world size with some sort of boundary as a sort of fail-safe against losing your base that you had so much invested in.
